text: thumb John Lovic Crawford was a doctor, state legislator, and Florida Secretary of State. Crawfordville, Florida is named for him. He was born in Greene County, Georgia. Crawford was elected to the Florida House of Representatives in 1847, served in the Florida State Senate for several terms between 1868 and 1880, and served as Florida Secretary of State from 1881 until 1902. He was succeeded as Florida Secretary of State by his son Henry Clay Crawford. He was photographed with other state leaders on the steps of the state capitol in 1885. He married Elizabeth E. Walker in 1848. ==References== Category:People from Greene County, Georgia Category:Members of the Florida House of Representatives Category:Florida state senators Category:19th-century American politicians Category:Florida Democrats Category:Secretaries of State of Florida Category:Physicians from Florida Category:19th-century American physicians
title: John L. Crawford
